page.title: 12A DAY IN THE LIFE OF PERCY
page.content: Percy Stone, aged 75, is Pangbourne's miller and corn merchant. He has lived in the Mill House all his life and still goes to work at 7.30 a.m. He packs flour and yeast to sell to the customers in his shop in the High Street. He goes home for lunch between 1.00 and 2.00p.m., returns to work and finishes for the day around 5.00pm. His wife is 72 and is a housewife. She does voluntary work for Oxfam and the National Trust. They have four married children and eleven grandchildren. Their hobbies include visiting National Trust houses, visiting exhibitions and watching the news, plays and travel programmes on TV. A book about Percy's grandfather{'Robert {- Stone Miller of Pangbourne'}was published in 1980. It consists of his diary and reveals a great deal about life between 1169 and 1882.
